   20: -module(zip_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, borderline/1, atomic/1,
   24:          bad_zip/1, unzip_from_binary/1, unzip_to_binary/1,
   25:          zip_to_binary/1,
   26:          unzip_options/1, zip_options/1, list_dir_options/1, aliases/1,
   27:          openzip_api/1, zip_api/1, open_leak/1, unzip_jar/1,
   28: 	 unzip_traversal_exploit/1,
   29:          compress_control/1,
   30: 	 foldl/1,fd_leak/1,unicode/1,test_zip_dir/1]).
   31: 
   32: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   33: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   34: -include_lib("stdlib/include/zip.hrl").
   35: 
   36: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   37: 
   38: all() -> 
   39:     [borderline, atomic, bad_zip, unzip_from_binary,
   40:      unzip_to_binary, zip_to_binary, unzip_options,
   41:      zip_options, list_dir_options, aliases, openzip_api,
   42:      zip_api, open_leak, unzip_jar, compress_control, foldl,
   43:      unzip_traversal_exploit,fd_leak,unicode,test_zip_dir].
   44: 
   45: groups() -> 
   46:     [].
   47: 
   48: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   49:     Config.
   50: 
   51: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   52:     ok.
   53: 
   54: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   55:     Config.
   56: 
   57: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: 
   61: %% Test creating, listing and extracting one file from an archive
   62: %% multiple times with different file sizes. Also check that the
   63: %% modification date of the extracted file has survived.
   64: borderline(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   65:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   66:     TempDir = filename:join(RootDir, "borderline"),
   67:     ok = file:make_dir(TempDir),
   68: 
   69:     Record = 512,
   70:     Block = 20 * Record,
   71: 
   72:     lists:foreach(fun(Size) -> borderline_test(Size, TempDir) end,
   73:                   [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 333, Record-1, Record, Record+1,
   74:                    Block-Record-1, Block-Record, Block-Record+1,
   75:                    Block-1, Block, Block+1,
   76:                    Block+Record-1, Block+Record, Block+Record+1]),
   77: 
   78:     %% Clean up.
   79:     delete_files([TempDir]),
   80:     ok.
   81: 
   82: borderline_test(Size, TempDir) ->
   83:     Archive = filename:join(TempDir, "ar_"++integer_to_list(Size)++".zip"),
   84:     Name = filename:join(TempDir, "file_"++integer_to_list(Size)),
   85:     io:format("Testing size ~p", [Size]),
   86: 
   87:     %% Create a file and archive it.
   88:     {_, _, X0} = erlang:timestamp(),
   89:     file:write_file(Name, random_byte_list(X0, Size)),
   90:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [Name]),
   91:     ok = file:delete(Name),
   92: 
   93:     %% Verify listing and extracting.
   94:     {ok, [#zip_comment{comment = []},
   95:           #zip_file{name = Name,
   96:                     info = Info,
   97:                     offset = 0,
   98:                     comp_size = _}]} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
   99:     Size = Info#file_info.size,
  100:     {ok, [Name]} = zip:extract(Archive, [verbose]),
  101: 
  102:     %% Verify contents of extracted file.
  103:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Name),
  104:     true = match_byte_list(X0, binary_to_list(Bin)),
  105: 
  106: 
  107:     %% Verify that Unix zip can read it. (if we have a unix zip that is!)
  108:     zipinfo_match(Archive, Name),
  109: 
  110:     ok.
  111: 
  112: zipinfo_match(Archive, Name) ->
  113:     case check_zipinfo_exists() of
  114:         true ->
  115:             Encoding = file:native_name_encoding(),
  116:             Expect = unicode:characters_to_binary(Name ++ "\n",
  117:                                                   Encoding, Encoding),
  118:             cmd_expect("zipinfo -1 " ++ Archive, Expect);
  119:         _ ->
  120:             ok
  121:     end.
  122: 
  123: check_zipinfo_exists() ->
  124:     is_list(os:find_executable("zipinfo")).
  125: 
  126: cmd_expect(Cmd, Expect) ->
  127:     Port = open_port({spawn, make_cmd(Cmd)}, [stream, in, binary, eof]),
  128:     get_data(Port, Expect, <<>>).
  129: 
  130: get_data(Port, Expect, Acc) ->
  131:     receive
  132:         {Port, {data, Bytes}} ->
  133:             get_data(Port, Expect, <<Acc/binary, Bytes/binary>>);
  134:         {Port, eof} ->
  135:             Port ! {self(), close},
  136:             receive
  137:                 {Port, closed} ->
  138:                     true
  139:             end,
  140:             receive
  141:                 {'EXIT',  Port,  _} ->
  142:                     ok
  143:             after 1 ->                          % force context switch
  144:                     ok
  145:             end,
  146:             match_output(Acc, Expect, Port)
  147:     end.
  148: 
  149: match_output(<<C, Output/bits>>, <<C,Expect/bits>>, Port) ->
  150:     match_output(Output, Expect, Port);
  151: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>, <<_, _/bits>>, Port) ->
  152:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, badmatch);
  153: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>=Rest, <<>>, Port) ->
  154:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, {too_much_data, Rest});
  155: match_output(<<>>, <<>>, _Port) ->
  156:     ok.
  157: 
  158: kill_port_and_fail(Port, Reason) ->
  159:     unlink(Port),
  160:     exit(Port, die),
  161:     ct:fail(Reason).
  162: 
  163: make_cmd(Cmd) ->
  164:     Cmd.
  165: %%     case os:type() of
  166: %%      {win32, _} -> lists:concat(["cmd /c",  Cmd]);
  167: %%      {unix, _}  -> lists:concat(["sh -c '",  Cmd,  "'"])
  168: %%     end.
  169: 
  170: %% Verifies a random byte list.
  171: 
  172: match_byte_list(X0, [Byte|Rest]) ->
  173:     X = next_random(X0),
  174:     case (X bsr 26) band 16#ff of
  175:         Byte -> match_byte_list(X, Rest);
  176:         _ -> false
  177:     end;
  178: match_byte_list(_, []) ->
  179:     true.
  180: 
  181: %% Generates a random byte list.
  182: 
  183: random_byte_list(X0, Count) ->
  184:     random_byte_list(X0, Count, []).
  185: 
  186: random_byte_list(X0, Count, Result) when Count > 0->
  187:     X = next_random(X0),
  188:     random_byte_list(X, Count-1, [(X bsr 26) band 16#ff|Result]);
  189: random_byte_list(_X, 0, Result) ->
  190:     lists:reverse(Result).
  191: 
  192: %% This RNG is from line 21 on page 102 in Knuth: The Art of Computer Programming,
  193: %% Volume II, Seminumerical Algorithms.
  194: 
  195: next_random(X) ->
  196:     (X*17059465+1) band 16#fffffffff.
  197: 
  198: %% Test the 'atomic' operations: zip/unzip/list_dir, on archives.
  199: %% Also test the 'cooked' option.
  200: atomic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  201:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  202:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  203:     Names = [Name || {Name,_,_} <- DataFiles],
  204:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  205: 
  206:     %% Create a zip  archive.
  207: 
  208:     Zip2 = "zip.zip",
  209:     {ok, Zip2} = zip:zip(Zip2, Names, []),
  210:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip2)),
  211: 
  212:     %% Same test again, but this time created with 'cooked'
  213: 
  214:     Zip3 = "cooked.zip",
  215:     {ok, Zip3} = zip:zip(Zip3, Names, [cooked]),
  216:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3)),
  217:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3, [cooked])),
  218: 
  219:     %% Clean up.
  220:     delete_files([Zip2,Zip3|Names]),
  221: 
  222:     ok.
  223: 
  224: %% Test the openzip_open/2, openzip_get/1, openzip_get/2, openzip_close/1
  225: %% and openzip_list_dir/1 functions.
  226: openzip_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  227:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  228:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  229:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  230:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  231: 
  232:     %% Create a zip archive
  233: 
  234:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  235:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, Names, []),
  236: 
  237:     %% Open archive
  238:     {ok, OpenZip} = zip:openzip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  239: 
  240:     %% List dir
  241:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:openzip_list_dir(OpenZip)),
  242: 
  243:     %% Get a file
  244:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  245:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(Name1),
  246:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:openzip_get(Name1, OpenZip),
  247: 
  248:     %% Get all files
  249:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(Name),
  250:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  251:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:openzip_get(OpenZip),
  252: 
  253:     %% Close
  254:     ok = zip:openzip_close(OpenZip),
  255: 
  256:     %% Clean up.
  257:     delete_files([Names]),
  258: 
  259:     ok.
  260: 
  261: %% Test the zip_open/2, zip_get/1, zip_get/2, zip_close/1,
  262: %% and zip_list_dir/1 functions.
  263: zip_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  264:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  265:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  266:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  267:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  268: 
  269:     %% Create a zip archive
  270:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  271:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, Names, []),
  272: 
  273:     %% Open archive
  274:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  275: 
  276:     %% List dir
  277:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  278: 
  279:     %% Get a file
  280:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  281:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(Name1),
  282:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  283:     Data1Crc = erlang:crc32(Data1),
  284:     {ok, Data1Crc} = zip:zip_get_crc32(Name1, ZipSrv),
  285: 
  286:     %% Get all files
  287:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(Name),
  288:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  289:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  290: 
  291:     %% Close
  292:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  293: 
  294:     %% Clean up.
  295:     delete_files([Names]),
  296: 
  297:     ok.
  298: 
  299: %% Test that zip doesn't leak processes and ports where the
  300: %% controlling process dies without closing an zip opened with
  301: %% zip:zip_open/1.
  302: open_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  303:     %% Create a zip archive
  304:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  305:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, [], []),
  306: 
  307:     %% Open archive in a another process that dies immediately.
  308:     ZipSrv = spawn_zip(Zip, [memory]),
  309: 
  310:     %% Expect the ZipSrv process to die soon after.
  311:     true = spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv),
  312: 
  313:     %% Clean up.
  314:     delete_files([Zip]),
  315: 
  316:     ok.
  317: 
  318: spawn_zip(Zip, Options) ->
  319:     Self = self(),
  320:     spawn(fun() -> Self ! zip:zip_open(Zip, Options) end),
  321:     receive
  322:         {ok, ZipSrv} ->
  323:             ZipSrv
  324:     end.
  325: 
  326: spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv) ->
  327:     Ref = monitor(process, ZipSrv),
  328:     receive
  329:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, ZipSrv, _} ->
  330:             true
  331:     after 1000 ->
  332:             false
  333:     end.
  334: 
  335: %% Test options for unzip, only cwd and file_list currently.
  336: unzip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  337:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  338:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  339:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  340: 
  341:     %% create a temp directory
  342:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "t"),
  343:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  344: 
  345:     FList = ["quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt"],
  346: 
  347:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  348:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},
  349: 				     {file_list, FList}]),
  350: 
  351:     %% Verify.
  352:     true = (length(FList) =:= length(RetList)),
  353:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  354: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  355: 		  FList),
  356:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  357: 		  RetList),
  358: 
  359:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  360:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  361:     ok.
  362: 
  363: %% Test that unzip handles directory traversal exploit (OTP-13633)
  364: unzip_traversal_exploit(Config) ->
  365:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  366:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  367:     ZipName = filename:join(DataDir, "exploit.zip"),
  368: 
  369:     %% $ zipinfo -1 test/zip_SUITE_data/exploit.zip 
  370:     %% clash.txt
  371:     %% ../clash.txt
  372:     %% ../above.txt
  373:     %% subdir/../in_root_dir.txt
  374: 
  375:     %% create a temp directory
  376:     SubDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "exploit_test"),
  377:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  378:     
  379:     ClashFile = filename:join(SubDir,"clash.txt"),
  380:     AboveFile = filename:join(SubDir,"above.txt"),
  381:     RelativePathFile = filename:join(SubDir,"subdir/../in_root_dir.txt"),
  382: 
  383:     %% unzip in SubDir
  384:     {ok, [ClashFile, ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  385: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir}]),
  386: 
  387:     {ok,<<"This file will overwrite other file.\n">>} =
  388: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  389:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(AboveFile),
  390:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(RelativePathFile),
  391: 
  392:     %% clean up
  393:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  394:     
  395:      %% create the temp directory again
  396:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  397: 
  398:     %% unzip in SubDir
  399:     {ok, [ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  400: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir},keep_old_files]),
  401: 
  402:     {ok,<<"This is the original file.\n">>} =
  403: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  404:    
  405:     %% clean up
  406:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  407:     ok.
  408: 
  409: %% Test unzip a jar file (OTP-7382).
  410: unzip_jar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  411:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  412:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  413:     JarFile = filename:join(DataDir, "test.jar"),
  414: 
  415:     %% create a temp directory
  416:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "jartest"),
  417:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  418:     ok = file:set_cwd(Subdir),
  419: 
  420:     FList = ["META-INF/MANIFEST.MF","test.txt"],
  421: 
  422:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(JarFile),
  423: 
  424:     %% Verify.
  425:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  426: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  427: 		  FList),
  428:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  429: 		  RetList),
  430: 
  431:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  432:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  433:     ok.
  434: 
  435: %% Test the options for unzip, only cwd currently.
  436: zip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  437:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  438:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  439:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  440:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  441: 
  442:     %% Make sure cwd is not where we get the files
  443:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  444: 
  445:     %% Create a zip archive
  446:     {ok, {_,Zip}} =
  447:         zip:zip("filename_not_used.zip", Names, [memory, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
  448: 
  449:     %% Open archive
  450:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  451: 
  452:     %% List dir
  453:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  454: 
  455:     %% Get a file
  456:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  457:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name1)),
  458:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  459: 
  460:     %% Get all files
  461:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name)),
  462:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  463:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  464: 
  465:     %% Close
  466:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  467: 
  468:     %% Clean up.
  469:     delete_files([Names]),
  470: 
  471:     ok.
  472: 
  473: %% Test the options for list_dir... one day.
  474: list_dir_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  475:     ok.
  476: 
  477: 
  478: 
  479: 
  480: %% convert zip_info as returned from list_dir to a list of names
  481: names_from_list_dir({ok, Info}) ->
  482:     names_from_list_dir(Info);
  483: names_from_list_dir(Info) ->
  484:     tl(lists:map(fun(#zip_file{name = Name}) -> Name;
  485:                     (_) -> ok end, Info)).
  486: 
  487: %% Returns a sequence of characters.
  488: char_seq(N, First) ->
  489:     char_seq(N, First, []).
  490: 
  491: char_seq(0, _, Result) ->
  492:     Result;
  493: char_seq(N, C, Result) when C < 127 ->
  494:     char_seq(N-1, C+1, [C|Result]);
  495: char_seq(N, _, Result) ->
  496:     char_seq(N, $!, Result).
  497: 
  498: data_files() ->
  499:     Files = [{"first_file", 1555, $a},
  500:              {"small_file", 7, $d},
  501:              {"big_file", 23875, $e},
  502:              {"last_file", 7500, $g}],
  503:     create_files(Files),
  504:     Files.
  505: 
  506: create_files([{Name, dir, _First}|Rest]) ->
  507:     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  508:     create_files(Rest);
  509: create_files([{Name, Size, First}|Rest]) when is_integer(Size) ->
  510:     ok = file:write_file(Name, char_seq(Size, First)),
  511:     create_files(Rest);
  512: create_files([]) ->
  513:     ok.
  514: 
  515: %% make_dirs([Dir|Rest], []) ->
  516: %%     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  517: %%     make_dirs(Rest, Dir);
  518: %% make_dirs([Dir|Rest], Parent) ->
  519: %%     Name = filename:join(Parent, Dir),
  520: %%     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  521: %%     make_dirs(Rest, Name);
  522: %% make_dirs([], Dir) ->
  523: %%     Dir.
  524: 
  525: %% Try zip:unzip/1 on some corrupted zip files.
  526: bad_zip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  527:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  528:     try_bad("bad_crc",    {bad_crc, "abc.txt"}, Config),
  529:     try_bad("bad_central_directory", bad_central_directory, Config),
  530:     try_bad("bad_file_header",    bad_file_header, Config),
  531:     try_bad("bad_eocd",    bad_eocd, Config),
  532:     try_bad("enoent", enoent, Config),
  533:     GetNotFound = fun(A) ->
  534:                           {ok, O} = zip:openzip_open(A, []),
  535:                           zip:openzip_get("not_here", O)
  536:                   end,
  537:     try_bad("abc", file_not_found, GetNotFound, Config),
  538:     ok.
  539: 
  540: try_bad(N, R, Config) ->
  541:     try_bad(N, R, fun(A) -> io:format("name : ~p\n", [A]),
  542:                             zip:unzip(A, [verbose]) end, Config).
  543: 
  544: try_bad(Name0, Reason, What, Config) ->
  545:     %% Intentionally no macros here.
  546: 
  547:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  548:     Name = Name0 ++ ".zip",
  549:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [Name]),
  550:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
  551:     Expected = {error, Reason},
  552:     case What(Full) of
  553:         Expected ->
  554:             io:format("Result: ~p\n", [Expected]);
  555:         Other ->
  556:             io:format("unzip/2 returned ~p (expected ~p)\n", [Other, Expected]),
  557:             ct:fail({bad_return_value, Other})
  558:     end.
  559: 
  560: %% Test extracting to binary with memory option.
  561: unzip_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  562:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  563:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  564:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "unzip_to_binary"),
  565:     _ = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  566: 
  567:     ok = file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  568:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  569: 
  570:     %% Unzip a zip file into a binary
  571:     {ok, FBList} = zip:unzip(Long, [memory]),
  572: 
  573:     %% Verify.
  574:     lists:foreach(fun({F,B}) -> {ok,B}=file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F))
  575:                   end, FBList),
  576: 
  577:     %% Make sure no files created in cwd
  578:     {ok,[]} = file:list_dir(WorkDir),
  579: 
  580:     ok.
  581: 
  582: %% Test compressing to binary with memory option.
  583: zip_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  584:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  585:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  586:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "zip_to_binary"),
  587:     _ = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  588: 
  589:     file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  590:     FileName = "abc.txt",
  591:     ZipName = "t.zip",
  592:     FilePath = filename:join(DataDir, FileName),
  593:     {ok, _Size} = file:copy(FilePath, FileName),
  594: 
  595:     %% Zip to a binary archive
  596:     {ok, {ZipName, ZipB}} = zip:zip(ZipName, [FileName], [memory]),
  597: 
  598:     %% Make sure no files created in cwd
  599:     {ok,[FileName]} = file:list_dir(WorkDir),
  600: 
  601:     %% Zip to a file
  602:     {ok, ZipName} = zip:zip(ZipName, [FileName]),
  603: 
  604:     %% Verify.
  605:     {ok, ZipB} = file:read_file(ZipName),
  606:     {ok, FData} = file:read_file(FileName),
  607:     {ok, [{FileName, FData}]} = zip:unzip(ZipB, [memory]),
  608: 
  609:     %% Clean up.
  610:     delete_files([FileName, ZipName]),
  611: 
  612:     ok.
  613: 
  614: %% Test using the aliases, extract/2, table/2 and create/3.
  615: aliases(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  616:     {_, _, X0} = erlang:timestamp(),
  617:     Size = 100,
  618:     B = list_to_binary(random_byte_list(X0, Size)),
  619:     %% create
  620:     {ok, {"z.zip", ZArchive}} = zip:create("z.zip", [{"b", B}], [memory]),
  621:     %% extract
  622:     {ok, [{"b", B}]} = zip:extract(ZArchive, [memory]),
  623:     %% table
  624:     {ok, [#zip_comment{comment = _}, #zip_file{name = "b",
  625:                                                info = FI,
  626:                                                comp_size = _,
  627:                                                offset = 0}]} =
  628:         zip:table(ZArchive),
  629:     Size = FI#file_info.size,
  630: 
  631:     ok.
  632: 
  633: 
  634: 
  635: %% Test extracting a zip archive from a binary.
  636: unzip_from_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  637:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  638:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  639:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_binary"),
  640:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  641:     Archive = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.zip"),
  642:     {ok, _Size} = file:copy(filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"), Archive),
  643:     FileName = "abc.txt",
  644:     Quote = "quotes/rain.txt",
  645:     Wikipedia = "wikipedia.txt",
  646:     EmptyFile = "emptyFile",
  647:     file:set_cwd(ExtractDir),
  648: 
  649:     %% Read a zip file into a binary and extract from the binary.
  650:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Archive),
  651:     {ok, [FileName,Quote,Wikipedia,EmptyFile]} = zip:unzip(Bin),
  652: 
  653:     %% Verify.
  654:     DestFilename = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.txt"),
  655:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, FileName)),
  656:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(DestFilename),
  657: 
  658:     DestQuote = filename:join([ExtractDir, "quotes", "rain.txt"]),
  659:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  660:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  661: 
  662:     %% Clean up.
  663:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, Archive, ExtractDir]),
  664:     ok.
  665: 
  666: %% oac_files() ->
  667: %%     Files = [{"oac_file", 1459, $x},
  668: %%           {"oac_small", 99, $w},
  669: %%           {"oac_big", 33896, $A}],
  670: %%     create_files(Files),
  671: %%     Files.
  672: 
  673: %% Delete the given list of files and directories.
  674: %% Return total number of deleted files (not directories)
  675: delete_files(List) ->
  676:     do_delete_files(List, 0).
  677: do_delete_files([],Cnt) ->
  678:     Cnt;
  679: do_delete_files([Item|Rest], Cnt) ->
  680:     case file:delete(Item) of
  681:         ok ->
  682:             DelCnt = 1;
  683:         {error,eperm} ->
  684:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  685:             DelCnt = delete_files(filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Item, "*"))),
  686:             file:del_dir(Item);
  687:         {error,eacces} ->
  688:             %% We'll see about that!
  689:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  690:             case file:delete(Item) of
  691:                 ok ->
  692: 		    DelCnt = 1;
  693:                 {error,_} ->
  694:                     erlang:yield(),
  695:                     file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  696:                     file:delete(Item),
  697:                     DelCnt = 1
  698:             end;
  699:         {error,_} ->
  700:             DelCnt = 0
  701:     end,
  702:     do_delete_files(Rest, Cnt + DelCnt).
  703: 
  704: %% Test control of which files that should be compressed.
  705: compress_control(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  706:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  707:     Dir = "compress_control",
  708:     Files = [
  709:              {Dir,                                                          dir,   $d},
  710:              {filename:join([Dir, "first_file.txt"]), 10000, $f},
  711:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  712:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "zzz.zip"]), 10000, $z},
  713:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "lll.lzh"]), 10000, $l},
  714:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "eee.exe"]), 10000, $e},
  715:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $g},
  716:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  717:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $a},
  718:              {filename:join([Dir, "last_file.txt"]), 10000, $l}
  719:             ],
  720: 
  721:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  722: 			  Files,
  723: 			  [{compress, []}],
  724: 			  []),
  725: 
  726:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  727: 			  Files,
  728: 			  [{uncompress, all}],
  729: 			  []),
  730: 
  731:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  732: 			  Files,
  733: 			  [{uncompress, []}],
  734: 			  [".txt", ".exe", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  735: 
  736:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  737: 			  Files,
  738: 			  [],
  739: 			  [".txt", ".exe"]),
  740: 
  741:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  742: 			  Files,
  743: 			  [{uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  744: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  745: 			  [".txt", ".zip", "arj"]),
  746: 
  747:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  748: 			  Files,
  749: 			  [{uncompress, []},
  750: 			   {uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  751: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  752: 			  [".txt", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  753: 
  754:     ok.
  755: 
  756: test_compress_control(Dir, Files, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  757:     %% Cleanup
  758:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  759:     Names = [N || {N, _, _} <- Files],
  760:     delete_files([Zip]),
  761:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)),
  762: 
  763:     create_files(Files),
  764:     {ok, Zip} = zip:create(Zip, [Dir], ZipOptions),
  765: 
  766:     {ok, OpenZip} = zip:openzip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  767:     {ok,[#zip_comment{comment = ""} | ZipList]} = zip:openzip_list_dir(OpenZip),
  768:     io:format("compress_control:  -> ~p  -> ~p\n  -> ~pn", [Expected, ZipOptions, ZipList]),
  769:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected),
  770:     ok = zip:openzip_close(OpenZip),
  771: 
  772:     %% Cleanup
  773:     delete_files([Zip]),
  774:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)), % Remove plain files before directories
  775: 
  776:     ok.
  777: 
  778: verify_compression([{Name, Kind, _Filler} | Files], ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  779:     {Name2, BinSz} =
  780:         case Kind of
  781:             dir ->
  782:                 {Name ++ "/", 0};
  783:             _   ->
  784:                 {ok, {Name, Bin}} = zip:openzip_get(Name, OpenZip),
  785:                 {Name, size(Bin)}
  786:         end,
  787:     {Name2, {value, ZipFile}} = {Name2, lists:keysearch(Name2,  #zip_file.name, ZipList)},
  788:     #zip_file{info = #file_info{size = InfoSz, type = InfoType}, comp_size = InfoCompSz} = ZipFile,
  789: 
  790:     Ext = filename:extension(Name),
  791:     IsComp = is_compressed(Ext, Kind, ZipOptions),
  792:     ExpComp = lists:member(Ext, Expected),
  793:     case {Name, Kind, InfoType, IsComp, ExpComp, BinSz, InfoSz, InfoCompSz} of
  794:         {_, dir, directory, false, _,     Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  795:         {_, Sz,  regular,   false, false, Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  796:         {_, Sz,  regular,   true,  true,  Sz, Sz, OtherSz} when Sz =:= BinSz, OtherSz =/= BinSz -> ok
  797:     end,
  798:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList -- [ZipFile], OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected);
  799: verify_compression([], [], _OpenZip, _ZipOptions, _Expected) ->
  800:     ok.
  801: 
  802: is_compressed(_Ext, dir, _Options) ->
  803:     false;
  804: is_compressed(Ext, _Sz, Options) ->
  805:     CompressOpt =
  806:         case [What || {compress, What} <- Options] of
  807:             [] -> all;
  808:             CompressOpts-> extensions(CompressOpts, all)
  809:         end,
  810:     DoCompress = (CompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, CompressOpt),
  811:     Default = [".Z", ".zip", ".zoo", ".arc", ".lzh", ".arj"],
  812:     UncompressOpt =
  813:         case [What || {uncompress, What} <- Options] of
  814:             [] -> Default;
  815:             UncompressOpts-> extensions(UncompressOpts, Default)
  816:         end,
  817:     DoUncompress = (UncompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, UncompressOpt),
  818:     DoCompress andalso not DoUncompress.
  819: 
  820: extensions([H | T], Old) ->
  821:     case H of
  822:         all ->
  823:             extensions(T, H);
  824:         H when is_list(H) ->
  825:             extensions(T, H);
  826:         {add, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  827:             extensions(T, Old ++ New);
  828:         {del, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  829:             extensions(T, Old -- New);
  830:         _ ->
  831:             extensions(T, Old)
  832:     end;
  833: extensions([], Old) ->
  834:     Old.
  835: 
  836: foldl(Config) ->
  837:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  838:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "foldl.zip"]),
  839: 
  840:     FooBin = <<"FOO">>,
  841:     BarBin = <<"BAR">>,
  842:     Files = [{"foo", FooBin}, {"bar", BarBin}],
  843:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, Files, [memory]),
  844:     ZipFun = fun(N, I, B, Acc) -> [{N, B(), I()} | Acc] end,
  845:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, Bin}),
  846:     [{"bar", BarBin, #file_info{}}, {"foo", FooBin, #file_info{}}] = FileSpec,
  847:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, lists:reverse(FileSpec), [memory]),
  848:     {foo_bin, FooBin} =
  849: 	try
  850: 	    zip:foldl(fun("foo", _, B, _) -> throw(B()); (_, _, _, Acc) -> Acc end, [], {File, Bin})
  851: 	catch
  852: 	    throw:FooBin ->
  853: 		{foo_bin, FooBin}
  854: 	end,
  855:     ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  856:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
  857: 
  858:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(fun() -> ok end, [], File),
  859:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], 42),
  860:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, 42}),
  861: 
  862:     ok = file:delete(File),
  863:     {error, enoent} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
  864: 
  865:     ok.
  866: 
  867: fd_leak(Config) ->
  868:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  869:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  870:     Name = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_file_header.zip"),
  871:     BadExtract = fun() ->
  872:                          {error,bad_file_header} = zip:extract(Name),
  873:                          ok
  874:                  end,
  875:     do_fd_leak(BadExtract, 1),
  876: 
  877:     BadCreate = fun() ->
  878:                         {error,enoent} = zip:zip("failed.zip",
  879:                                                  ["none"]),
  880:                         ok
  881:                 end,
  882:     do_fd_leak(BadCreate, 1),
  883: 
  884:     ok.
  885: 
  886: do_fd_leak(_Bad, 10000) ->
  887:     ok;
  888: do_fd_leak(Bad, N) ->
  889:     try Bad() of
  890:         ok ->
  891:             do_fd_leak(Bad, N + 1)
  892:     catch
  893:         C:R:Stk ->
  894:             io:format("Bad error after ~p attempts\n", [N]),
  895:             erlang:raise(C, R, Stk)
  896:     end.
  897: 
  898: unicode(Config) ->
  899:     case file:native_name_encoding() of
  900:         latin1 ->
  901:             {comment, "Native name encoding is Latin-1; skipping all tests"};
  902:         utf8 ->
  903:             DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  904:             ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  905:             test_file_comment(DataDir),
  906:             test_archive_comment(DataDir),
  907:             test_bad_comment(DataDir),
  908:             test_latin1_archive(DataDir),
  909:             case has_zip() of
  910:                 false ->
  911:                     {comment, "No zip program found; skipping some tests"};
  912:                 true ->
  913:                     case zip_is_unicode_aware() of
  914:                         true ->
  915:                             test_filename_compatibility(),
  916:                             ok;
  917:                         false ->
  918:                             {comment, "Old zip program; skipping some tests"}
  919:                     end
  920:             end
  921:     end.
  922: 
  923: test_filename_compatibility() ->
  924:     FancyName = "d",
  925:     Archive = "test.zip",
  926: 
  927:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [{FancyName, <<"test">>}]),
  928:     zipinfo_match(Archive, FancyName).
  929: 
  930: test_file_comment(DataDir) ->
  931:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_file_comment.zip"),
  932:     Comments = ["a", [246], [1024]],
  933:     FileNames = [[C] ++ ".txt" || C <- [$a, 246, 1024]],
  934:     [begin
  935:          test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive),
  936:          test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive)
  937:      end ||
  938:         Comment <- Comments, FileName <- FileNames],
  939:     ok.
  940: 
  941: test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
  942:     _ = file:delete(Archive),
  943:     io:format("*** zip:zip(). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
  944:               [FileName, Comment]),
  945:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
  946:     {ok, Archive} =
  947:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
  948:     zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "").
  949: 
  950: test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
  951:     case test_zip1() of
  952:         false ->
  953:             ok;
  954:         true ->
  955:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
  956:             io:format("*** zip(1). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
  957:                       [FileName, Comment]),
  958:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
  959:             R = os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -c " ++
  960:                            Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
  961:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [R]),
  962:             zip_check(Archive, "", FileName, Comment)
  963:     end.
  964: 
  965: test_archive_comment(DataDir) ->
  966:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_archive_comment.zip"),
  967:     Chars = [$a, 246, 1024],
  968:     [test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) || Char <- Chars],
  969:     ok.
  970: 
  971: test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) ->
  972:     case test_zip1() of
  973:         false ->
  974:             ok;
  975:         true ->
  976:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
  977:             FileName = "a.txt",
  978:             Comment = [Char],
  979:             io:format("*** Testing archive Comment ~ts\n", [Comment]),
  980:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
  981: 
  982:             {ok, _} =
  983:                 zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
  984:             Res = os:cmd("zip -z " ++ Archive),
  985:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [Res]),
  986:             true = lists:member(Char, Res),
  987: 
  988:             os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -z "++
  989:                        Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
  990:             zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "")
  991:     end.
  992: 
  993: test_zip1() ->
  994:     has_zip() andalso zip_is_unicode_aware().
  995: 
  996: has_zip() ->
  997:     os:find_executable("zip") =/= false.
  998: 
  999: zip_is_unicode_aware() ->
 1000:     S = os:cmd("zip -v | grep 'UNICODE_SUPPORT'"),
 1001:     string:find(S, "UNICODE_SUPPORT") =/= nomatch.
 1002: 
 1003: zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, FileNameComment) ->
 1004:     {ok, CommentAndFiles} = zip:table(Archive),
 1005:     io:format("zip:table/1 returns\n  ~lp\n", [CommentAndFiles]),
 1006:     io:format("checking archive comment ~lp\n", [ArchiveComment]),
 1007:     [_] = [C || #zip_comment{comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1008:                 C =:= ArchiveComment],
 1009:     io:format("checking filename ~lp\n", [FileName]),
 1010:     io:format("and filename comment ~lp\n", [FileNameComment]),
 1011:     [_] = [F || #zip_file{name = F, comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1012:                 F =:= FileName, C =:= FileNameComment],
 1013:     {ok, FileList} = zip:unzip(Archive, [verbose]),
 1014:     io:format("zip:unzip/2 returns\n  ~lp\n", [FileList]),
 1015:     true = lists:member(FileName, FileList),
 1016:     ok.
 1017: 
 1018: test_bad_comment(DataDir) ->
 1019:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_bad_comment.zip"),
 1020:     FileName = "a.txt",
 1021:     file:write_file(FileName, ["something"]),
 1022:     Comment = [9999999],
 1023:     {error,{bad_unicode,Comment}} =
 1024:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]).
 1025: 
 1026: test_latin1_archive(DataDir) ->
 1027:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip-latin1.zip"),
 1028:     FileName = [246] ++ ".txt",
 1029:     ArchiveComment = [246],
 1030:     zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, "").
 1031: 
 1032: test_zip_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1033:     case {os:find_executable("unzip"), os:type()} of
 1034:         {UnzipPath, {unix,_}} when is_list(UnzipPath)->
 1035:             DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1036:             Dir = filename:join([DataDir, "test-zip", "dir-1"]),
 1037:             TestZipOutputDir = filename:join(DataDir, "test-zip-output"),
 1038:             TestZipOutput = filename:join(TestZipOutputDir, "test.zip"),
 1039:             zip:create(TestZipOutput, [Dir]),
 1040:             run_command(UnzipPath, ["-o", TestZipOutput,  "-d", TestZipOutputDir]),
 1041:             {ok, FileContent} = file:read_file(filename:join([TestZipOutputDir, Dir, "file.txt"])),
 1042:             <<"OKOK\n">> = FileContent,
 1043:             ok;
 1044:         _ -> {skip, "Not Unix or unzip program not found"}
 1045:     end.
 1046: 
 1047: run_command(Command, Args) ->
 1048:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_executable, Command}, [{args, Args}, exit_status]),
 1049:     (fun Reciver() ->
 1050:              receive
 1051:                  {Port,{exit_status,_}} -> ok;
 1052:                  {Port, S} -> io:format("UNZIP: ~p~n", [S]),
 1053:                               Reciver()
 1054:              end
 1055:      end)().
 1056:
